Identify the type of problem and the method typically used to address it.
Write the given fraction in a form that suggests partial fraction decomposition.
Set up the equation for partial fraction decomposition by equating the original fraction to the sum of simpler fractions whose denominators are the factors of the original denominator.
Multiply through by the common denominator to clear fractions.
Expand and simplify both sides of the equation so that corresponding terms can be matched.
Equate the coefficients of corresponding powers of \(x\) in the expressions obtained from both sides.
Solve the resulting system of linear equations for \(a\), \(b\), and \(c\).
Verify the solutions by substituting them back into the original partial fraction decomposition equation.

Identify the form of the partial fraction decomposition for the given expression (x+5)/((x-1)(x-2)(x-3)).
Set up the equation (x+5)/((x-1)(x-2)(x-3))=a/(x-1)+b/(x-2)+c/(x-3).
Multiply both sides of the equation by the common denominator (x-1)(x-2)(x-3) to clear the denominators.
Expand the right-hand side of the equation to combine like terms.
Equate the coefficients of like powers of x from both sides of the equation.
Solve the resulting system of linear equations to find the values of a, b, and c.
Verify the solution by substituting the values of a, b, and c back into the original partial fraction decomposition and simplifying.

Start by expressing the given fractional equation with x, (x+5)/((x-1)(x-2)(x-3)), in terms of the partial fractions form: a/(x-1) + b/(x-2) + c/(x-3).
Combine the right-hand side (RHS) over a common denominator, namely (x-1)(x-2)(x-3), and equate it to the left-hand side (LHS) of the original equation.
Expand the expression in the numerators on both sides after combining them on the RHS.
Collect like terms in x from both sides of the equation and equate the coefficients of corresponding powers of x in order to set up a system of equations.
Solve the system of equations for the variables a, b, and c.
Verify the values found for a, b, and c by substituting them back into the original partial fractions and checking if they satisfy the original equation.

Set up the equation such that each term on the right side has a common denominator: (x-1)(x-2)(x-3).
Express the equation (x+5)/((x-1)(x-2)(x-3)) as a single fraction over the common denominator.
Expand the right-hand side expression to express it over the common denominator: a/(x-1) + b/(x-2) + c/(x-3) = (a(x-2)(x-3) + b(x-1)(x-3) + c(x-1)(x-2))/((x-1)(x-2)(x-3)).
Equate the numerators from the left-hand side and the expanded right-hand side to form a polynomial equation.
Simplify and rearrange terms in the polynomial equation to match coefficients of corresponding powers of x from both sides.
Set up a system of equations based on the coefficients of x's powers matched from the earlier step.
Solve the system of linear equations for the unknowns a, b, and c.
